intro: Serrafalcus pauciflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flowered serrafalcus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species within the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
